deploy_to_render/environment_variables_a.description: A common way to configure applications before they start up is by using environment variables.

deploy_to_render/run_everything_docker_c.description: Up until now we've been running docker compose up to start the REST API container.

docker_intro/README.title: An Introduction to Docker

docker_intro/run_commands_in_docker_cont.description: If you run your API using Docker Compose, with the docker compose up command, you may also want to be able to execute arbitrary shell commands in the container.

docker_intro/run_with_docker_compose/REA.description: Now that we've got a Docker container for our REST API, we can set up Docker Compose to run the container.

docker_intro/what_is_docker_container/RE.title: What are Docker images and containers?
docker_intro/what_is_docker_container/RE.description: Learn what Docker images and containers are, and how we can use them to distribute and run our applications.

first_rest_api/first_rest_api_endpoint/R.description: Learn how to define a REST API endpoint using Flask.

first_rest_api/getting_set_up/README.title: Getting set up
first_rest_api/getting_set_up/README.description: Set up a Flask project and create the Flask app.

first_rest_api/make_request_to_rest_api/.title: How to interact with your REST API
first_rest_api/make_request_to_rest_api/.description: Use Postman and Insomnia REST Client to interact with your REST API.

first_rest_api/project_overview/README.title: Project Overview
first_rest_api/project_overview/README.description: A first look at the project we'll build in this section.

first_rest_api/return_data_from_rest_api.title: Get a specific store and its items
first_rest_api/return_data_from_rest_api.description: How to use Flask to return data from your REST API to your client.

first_rest_api/what_is_json/README.title: What is JSON?
first_rest_api/what_is_json/README.description: JSON is the way we normally transfer data to and from REST APIs.

flask_jwt_extended/flask_jwt_extended_se.title: Flask-JWT-Extended setup
flask_jwt_extended/flask_jwt_extended_se.description: Install and set up the Flask-JWT-Extended extension with our REST API.

flask_jwt_extended/how_is_jwt_used/READM.title: How are JWTs used?
flask_jwt_extended/how_is_jwt_used/READM.description: Learn who uses JWTs and how they are used by clients and servers to perform authentication.

flask_jwt_extended/insomnia_request_chai.title: Insomnia request chaining
flask_jwt_extended/insomnia_request_chai.description: Learn how to use Insomnia's Request Chaining to simplify our workflow and not have to copy-paste the access token in every request.

flask_jwt_extended/jwt_claims_and_author.title: JWT claims and authorization
flask_jwt_extended/jwt_claims_and_author.description: Learn how to add claims (extra info) to a JWT and use it for authorization in endpoints of a REST API.

flask_jwt_extended/login_users_rest_api/.title: How to add a login endpoint to the REST API
flask_jwt_extended/login_users_rest_api/.description: Learn how to add a login endpoint that returns a JWT to a REST API using Flask-Smorest and Flask-JWT-Extended.

flask_jwt_extended/logout_users_rest_api.title: How to add logout to the REST API
flask_jwt_extended/logout_users_rest_api.description: Create a logout endpoint that blocks certain JWTs from making further authenticated requests.

flask_jwt_extended/protect_resources_wit.title: Protect endpoints by requiring a JWT
flask_jwt_extended/protect_resources_wit.description: Use jwt_required from Flask-JWT-Extended to prevent unauthorised users from making requests to certain endpoints in a REST API.

flask_jwt_extended/registering_users_res.title: How to add a register endpoint to the REST API
flask_jwt_extended/registering_users_res.description: Learn how to add a registration endpoint to a REST API using Flask-Smorest and Flask-JWT-Extended.

flask_jwt_extended/section_changes/READM.title: Changes in this section
flask_jwt_extended/section_changes/READM.description: Overview of the API endpoints we'll use for user registration and authentication.

flask_jwt_extended/token_refreshing_flas.title: Token refreshing with Flask-JWT-Extended
flask_jwt_extended/token_refreshing_flas.description: Learn about fresh and non-fresh tokens, as well as how to use a refresh token to generate a new, non-fresh access token.

flask_jwt_extended/user_model_and_schema.title: The User model and schema
flask_jwt_extended/user_model_and_schema.description: Create the SQLAlchemy User model and marshmallow schema.

flask_jwt_extended/what_is_a_jwt/README.title: What is a JWT?
flask_jwt_extended/what_is_a_jwt/README.description: Understand what a JWT is, what data it contains, and how it may be used.

flask_migrate/add_flask_migrate_to_app/R.title: How to add Flask-Migrate to our Flask app
flask_migrate/add_flask_migrate_to_app/R.description: Integrating your Flask app with Flask-Migrate is relatively straightforward. Learn how to do it in this lecture.

flask_migrate/change_models_generate_ale.title: Change SQLAlchemy models and generate a migration
flask_migrate/change_models_generate_ale.description: Use Flask-Migrate to generate a new database migration after changing your SQLAlchemy models.

flask_migrate/initialize_database_flask_.title: Initialize your database with Flask-Migrate
flask_migrate/initialize_database_flask_.description: Learn the first steps when starting with Flask-Migrate: initializing the database.

flask_migrate/manually_review_modify_mig.title: Manually review and modify database migrations
flask_migrate/manually_review_modify_mig.description: Alembic can generate database migrations parting from model changes, but sometimes we need to modify them manually.

flask_migrate/why_use_database_migration.title: Why use database migrations?
flask_migrate/why_use_database_migration.description: Learn about database migrations and what they are useful for.

flask_smorest/api_with_method_views/READ.title: How to use Blueprints and MethodViews
flask_smorest/api_with_method_views/READ.description: Flask-Smorest MethodViews allow us to simplify API Resources by defining all methods that interact with the resource in one Python class.

flask_smorest/data_model_improvements/RE.title: Data model improvements
flask_smorest/data_model_improvements/RE.description: Use dictionaries instead of lists for data storage, and store stores and items separately.

flask_smorest/decorating_responses/READM.title: Decorating responses with Flask-Smorest
flask_smorest/decorating_responses/READM.description: Add response serialization and status code to API endpoints, and add to your documentation in the process.

flask_smorest/improvements_on_first_rest.title: Improvements to our first REST API
flask_smorest/improvements_on_first_rest.description: Add new error handling and code improvements to the REST API before adding any new endpoints.

flask_smorest/marshmallow_schemas/README.title: Adding marshmallow schemas
flask_smorest/marshmallow_schemas/README.description: A marshmallow schema is useful for validation and serialization. Learn how to write them in this lecture.

flask_smorest/new_endpoints_for_api/READ.title: New endpoints for our REST API
flask_smorest/new_endpoints_for_api/READ.description: Let's add a few routes to our first REST API, so it better matches what a production REST API would look like.

flask_smorest/reload_api_docker_containe.title: Reloading API code in Docker container
flask_smorest/reload_api_docker_containe.description: Learn how to get your code instantly synced up to the Docker container, so that every time you make a code change it restarts the app in the container and uses the latest code.

flask_smorest/validation_with_marshmallo.title: Validation with marshmallow
flask_smorest/validation_with_marshmallo.description: We can use the marshmallow library to validate request data from our API clients.

flask_smorest/why_flask_smorest/README.title: Why use Flask-Smorest
flask_smorest/why_flask_smorest/README.description: There are many different REST API libraries for Flask. In a previous version of this course, we used Flask-RESTful. Now, I recommend using Flask-Smorest.

git_crash_course/README.title: Git Crash Course
git_crash_course/README.description: The Git Crash Course e-book is hosted in a different page because it is used in multiple courses.

python_refresher/index.title: Python Refresher
python_refresher/index.description: We've included a Python Refresher section in this course to help you, in case you haven't done any Python for a while or you are coming from a different programming language.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/conclusion/README.title: Conclusion of this section
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/conclusion/README.description: Review everything we've changed this section to add SQL storage with SQLAlchemy to our API.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/configure_flask_s.title: Configure Flask-SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/configure_flask_s.description: Link Flask-SQLAlchemy with our Flask app and create the initial tables.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/delete_models_sql.title: Delete models with SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/delete_models_sql.description: Use SQLAlchemy to handle removal of a specific model.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/delete_related_mo.title: Delete models with relationships using cascades
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/delete_related_mo.description: Tell SQLAlchemy what to do with related models when you delete the parent.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/get_models_or_404.title: Get models by ID from the database using SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/get_models_or_404.description: Learn how to fetch a specific model using its primary key column, and how to return a 404 page if it isn't found.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/insert_models_sql.title: Insert models in the database with SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/insert_models_sql.description: Learn how to use SQLAlchemy to add new rows to our SQL database.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/one_to_many_relat.title: One-to-many relationships with SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/one_to_many_relat.description: Model relationships let us easily retrieve information about a related model, without having to do SQL JOINs manually.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/project_overview_.title: Project Overview, and why use SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/project_overview_.description: Let's look at what we'll do in this section. There are no changes to the client-facing API at all, just changes internally to how we store data.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/retrieve_list_all.title: Retrieve a list of all models
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/retrieve_list_all.description: Get more than one model and return it as a list from the API.

sql_storage_sqlalchemy/updating_models_s.title: Updating models with SQLAlchemy
sql_storage_sqlalchemy/updating_models_s.description: How to make changes to an existing model, or insert one if it doesn't already exist.

sqlalchemy_many_to_many/many_to_many_rel.title: Many-to-many relationships
sqlalchemy_many_to_many/many_to_many_rel.description: Learn to set up a many-to-many relationship between two models using SQLAlchemy.

sqlalchemy_many_to_many/one_to_many_revi.title: One-to-many relationships review
sqlalchemy_many_to_many/one_to_many_revi.description: A super-quick look at creating the Tag model and setting up the one-to-many relationship with Stores.

sqlalchemy_many_to_many/section_changes/.title: Changes in this section
sqlalchemy_many_to_many/section_changes/.description: In this section we add Tags to our Stores, and link these to Items using a many-to-many relationship.

task_queues_emails/deploy_background_wor.title: Deploy the rq background worker to Render.com
task_queues_emails/deploy_background_wor.description: When deploying to Render.com, it's much easier if we don't have to pass the REDIS_URL and the queue name directly to the command.

task_queues_emails/populate_rq_task_queu.title: Populating and consuming the task queue with rq
task_queues_emails/populate_rq_task_queu.description: We'll be using the rq library for our task queue implementation. Another popular option is celery, which is substantially more complex. For most workloads, rq is sufficient and it's much easier to work with.

task_queues_emails/rq_background_worker/.title: Process background tasks with the rq worker
task_queues_emails/rq_background_worker/.description: We've got our queue and we've added tasks to it, but they won't run until we start consuming them and popping them off the queue.

task_queues_emails/send_email_user_regis.title: Sending emails when users register
task_queues_emails/send_email_user_regis.description: If we want to be able to send emails to users when they register, we'll need to:

task_queues_emails/send_emails_python_ma.title: How to send emails with Python and Mailgun
task_queues_emails/send_emails_python_ma.description: Remember to get the Insomnia files for this section or for all sections here!

task_queues_emails/sending_html_emails/R.title: Sending HTML emails with Mailgun
task_queues_emails/sending_html_emails/R.description: Until now, we've been sending exclusively text emails. These have a clear advantage: text is simple! They'll look the same in every email client and device, and for many things, text is good enough.

task_queues_emails/what_is_task_queue/RE.title: What is a task queue?
task_queues_emails/what_is_task_queue/RE.description: A queue is a data structure to which you can add and remove data, but a key aspect of it is that when you want to remove a piece of data from it, the piece of data removed is the first piece of data that was added.
